Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Monthly Stipend: Up to 9,000 TL per month (amount varies by study level).
Tuition Fee: Full coverage of university tuition fees.
Return Flight Ticket: A one-time return flight ticket to and from Türkiye.
Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance, allowing access to widespread health services.
Accommodation: Provision of accommodation, typically in university dormitories.
Turkish Language Course: A mandatory 1-year (8-month) Turkish Language Course for all awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate. This course aims to bring students to C1 level by June.
Quantity: Around 5,000 new scholarships are awarded each year
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must fulfill specific requirements that vary based on the level of study (undergraduate, master's, Ph.D.) and the specific scholarship category. General eligibility criteria typically apply to all applicants.
Academic Requirements:
Undergraduate: Minimum GPA of 70% or 3.0/4.0.
Master's: Minimum GPA of 75% or 3.5/4.0.
Ph.D.: Minimum GPA of 75%.
A higher GPA is crucial for competitive majors such as medicine and engineering.
Age Limits:
Undergraduate: Under 21 years of age.
Master's: Under 30 years of age.
Ph.D.: Under 35 years of age.
Research Scholarship: Under 50 years of age.
Test Requirements:
International Exam Results: GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc., are required if specified by the chosen university or program. SAT or ACT scores are often required for undergraduate applicants.
International Language Test Results: TOEFL, DELF, etc., are required if specified by the chosen university or program. Türkiye accepts TOEFL and sometimes IELTS, but not DET (Duolingo English Test).
Turkish Language Proficiency: All awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate (including those placed into English or other language medium programs) must attend a mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course and attain the C1 Level Certificate by the end of their academic year.
Other Eligibility Notes:
Nationality Criteria: Applicants must meet specific nationality criteria.
Current Enrollment: Individuals currently enrolled in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are eligible.
Special Programs: Some specific programs may require applicants to be between 25-45 years of age with five years and above of working experience.
General Qualities: Strong academic background, leadership skills, commitment to extracurricular activities, cultural sensitivity, and a strong resume are highly valued.
Experience_Years: Five years and above of working experience (for some specific programs)
Language_Certificate: C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate (or mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course); TOEFL, DELF, or IELTS if specified by university/program
Age: Undergraduate: Under 21; Master's: Under 30; Ph.D.: Under 35; Research Scholarship: Under 50; Some special programs: 25-45
Special_Circumstances: Applicants currently enrolled in Turkish universities at the same level are eligible; Undergraduate scholarships often regionally defined for developing countries and regions with historical links to Turkey.
Other_Requirements: Specific nationality criteria; Strong academic background, leadership skills, commitment to extracurricular activities, cultural sensitivity, and a strong resume are highly valued.
Scholarship_Info: The Türkiye Scholarships is a prestigious, government-funded, and highly competitive scholarship program offered by the Government of Turkey to international students. It aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Turkey and other countries by welcoming talented students from around the world to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top Turkish universities. The program aims to provide international students with free higher education and a unique life experience at prestigious Turkish universities, fostering educational and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
CNIC/Passport (copy)
Clear photo
High school diploma and transcript (for Bachelor's applicants)
Bachelor's degree and transcript (for Master's and Ph.D. applicants)
Motivation letter (Personal Statement, in English)
Letters of reference (highlighting strengths, achievements, and fit for the program)
International exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, ACT, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program.
International language test results (TOEFL, DELF, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program.
Timeline:
January 10 annually : Application Opening Date (for main scholarship programs)
February 20 annually : Application Deadline (for main scholarship programs)
4 times a year : Research Scholarship Applications received

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full exemption from tuition fees for the duration of the chosen program.
Economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile prior to the commencement of the course.
Economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile upon completion of the course.
Eligibility_Criteria:
General Eligibility: The scholarship is open to international students/foreign students who intend to pursue studies in Brunei Darussalam. Applicants must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.
Academic Requirements:
For Diploma/Undergraduate programs: Applicants must possess a minimum qualification of Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior (O-Level equivalent) examination.
For Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs: A Bachelor's degree from an accredited university with a minimum of Second-Class Honours (Upper Division) is required. Applicants must meet the minimum qualification set by the respective university for admission to graduate studies.
Experience Requirements: Applicants are generally expected to have 0-3 years of work experience. Work experience is an accepted type of experience.
Language Proficiency: Applicants must be proficient in English, demonstrated by: A Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination, OR A Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language), OR An IELTS score of 6.0. An English test is required, but other language tests are not required.
Age Limits: The age of a bachelor's degree student should not exceed 25 years. Generally, applicants must not exceed 25 years old.
Eligible_Field_Group: ARTS & DESIGN, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, STEM - ENGINEERING, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES
Min_Gpa: Range varies: 2.75/4.0 or equivalent, or No GPA requirement. Applicants advised to check university/program specific requirements.
Experience_Years: Applicants are generally expected to have 0-3 years of work experience. Work experience is an accepted type of experience.
Language_Certificate: A Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination, OR A Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language), OR An IELTS score of 6.0. An English test is required.
Age: Not exceed 25 years old (for Bachelor's degree students and generally for all applicants).
Other_Requirements:
UBD Applicants: Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal in addition to the BDGS application.
No Paid Employment: A scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship.
Departure Requirement: Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students Tenable in Brunei Darussalam (BDGS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme. Provided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Education and Sports, this scholarship aims to attract international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs in Brunei Darussalam. The scholarship is also referred to as BDGS (IS) for international students.
Application_Documents: online Application Form (BDGS Application Form). Applicants are advised to download and review the application procedures, eligibility criteria, and benefits from the official scholarship website.
Timeline:
2025-02-15 : Previous Application Deadline (earliest noted)
2025-02-28 : Previous Application Deadline (latest noted)
Academic Session 2025/2026 : Scholarship Period
Annually : Monitor official website for future academic sessions

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition-free education for the entire study period.
Monthly stipend:
For non-degree, bachelor’s, master’s, one-tier master’s, or postgraduate specialist training courses: HUF 43,700 (approximately EUR 110-115) per month, paid for 12 months a year, until the completion of studies.
For doctoral level: HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365) per month for the first 4 semesters (training and research period). HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470) per month for the second 4 semesters (research and dissertation period). Paid for 12 months a year, until the completion of studies.
Accommodation: Either free dormitory placement or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs for the entire scholarship period.
Medical Insurance: Supplementary medical insurance is covered up to HUF 65,000 (approximately EUR 160) annually.
Important Note: While the Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship provides valuable financial support, it may not cover all living expenses in Hungary.
Quantity: Thousands annually; more than 4,900 students were awarded scholarships for the 2020/2021 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be citizens of a partner country, and their nationality must match the program eligibility as determined by educational cooperation programs between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner.
Current self-financed (fee-paying) students in a Hungarian Higher Education Institution applying for the same study level are subject to specific eligibility restrictions, as outlined in the Call for Applications.
Scholarship renewal is contingent on maintaining minimum grade point average (GPA) and deportment grade requirements. For state-funded support, a minimum GPA of 4.0 (Good) under Hungary’s 5-point grading system is required.
Candidates need to be 18 years old before August 30th of the application year.
There are no explicit gender-based restrictions for the scholarship.
The scholarship includes a "Students at Risk Subprogramme" for specific circumstances.
Eligible_Fields: Education Sciences, Psychology, Humanities, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Social Sciences, Primary Education, Pre-School Education, Business Administration
Eligible_Field_Group: EDUCATION, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, STEM - COMPUTER SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree, Master's equivalent
Min_Gpa: Renewal/State-funded support: 4.0/5.0 (equivalent to B); Application acceptance: 56/100
Language_Certificate: Language proficiency requirements are outlined in detail in the Call for Applications for the relevant academic year. Proof can be uploaded if the previous level of studies was completed in the language of the selected study program. Translations of documents are required if they are not in the language of the selected study program or Hungarian.
Age: Minimum 18 years old before August 30th of the application year
Special_Circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme for specific circumstances.
Career_Plan:
For Pakistani nationals: Applicants must submit a bond to HEC agreeing not to change their discipline after the final award of the scholarship and to return to Pakistan to serve the country for a prescribed period after completing their degree.
For Kazakhstan nationals: Applicants must submit a document agreeing to return and work in Kazakhstan for a year after completing their studies.
Other_Requirements:
A Hungarian as a foreign language and culture course, offered free of charge by the Host Institution, is compulsory for all Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders who begin their studies in or after the fall semester of 2020.
Part-time work is possible for scholarship holders, but it is subject to Hungarian tax regulations.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Programme, established by the Hungarian Government in 2013, is a flagship initiative designed to promote the internationalization of Hungarian higher education and attract top international students globally. Managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation, the scholarship offers comprehensive financial support for studies in Hungary across Bachelor's, Master's, One-Tier Master's, Non-degree, and PhD programs. The program also fosters a supportive environment through its Mentor Network and the Alumni Hungary Network, offering career and networking opportunities.
Application_Documents:
Application guide and Call for Applications (for BA/MA/OTM and PhD programs).
Scanned copy of original secondary school graduation certificate or equivalent (for Bachelor's/One-Tier/Non-degree/Hungarian language prep programs) and its translation.
Scanned copy of original bachelor’s degree certificate or equivalent (for Master's programs) and its translation.
Certificate about student status (for partial studies) and its translation.
Transcripts of records from previous studies and their translations.
Translations of all documents if not in English or Hungarian.
"Statement for Application" (compulsory for all applicants).
"Statement of the Supervisor" (if required by the doctoral school for PhD programs, typically by March 15th for the current intake).
Proof of language proficiency (if applicable).
Pakistani nationals are required to submit online applications via both the Hungarian scholarship portal and the HEC scholarships portal (scholarship.hec.gov.pk).
Timeline:
mid-November : Application system opens
January 15th, 2 p.m. (Central European Time) : Main application deadline
March 15th : "Statement of the Supervisor" deadline (if required for PhD)
August 01, 2025 : Final degree and transcript submission for Pakistani nationals
September : Studies commence

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full tuition fee coverage: All academic fees are fully paid.
- Monthly stipend: Approximately 16,000 Baht is provided to support living and housing expenses.
- Accommodation: Covered as part of the scholarship benefits.
- Round-trip economy airfare: Reimbursement for travel costs, with the amount varying based on the applicant’s home location.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries, including Afghanistan, and candidates from all around the world. Foreign students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are explicitly not eligible to apply. Recipients are not permitted to accept any off-campus employment in Thailand during the scholarship term and must reside in Thailand throughout their study period.
Experience_Years: At least 3 years of work experience in any field, waiver option available for less
Language_Certificate: Certificate of English proficiency from prior university, TOEFL, or IELTS
Special_Circumstances: Faculty members, researchers, and academic staff who intend to return to teach in their home institutions are eligible to apply.
Career_Plan: A detailed study plan or description of academic interests, presented on a separate A4-sized paper, is required.
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are required, typically from the Head, the Director, or the Dean of the applicant's previous academic institution or workplace. Other required documents include: Copy of Certificate of Graduation, Official transcript of academic records, Copy of passport, One 1-inch-colored photo (with a blue background, taken no more than six months ago, in polite attire, and signed on the reverse side), Health certificate, Nomination letter from the home institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity for international students to pursue Master's or PhD degrees in Thailand. Provided by the Thai Government and Chulalongkorn University, this scholarship aims to attract excellent academic talent from around the world, fostering international collaboration and academic excellence at Thailand's oldest and most esteemed university. The program offers comprehensive financial support, covering tuition, living expenses, accommodation, and travel, making it a highly sought-after opportunity for graduate studies in Asia. It is a highly competitive and comprehensive opportunity, providing full financial assistance for Master’s and PhD degrees across all disciplines, emphasizing international collaboration and offering a unique experience to study at a top-tier institution in Thailand. The university is committed to providing an exceptional academic environment and support for its international scholars.
Application_Documents:
- Completed application form
- Curriculum Vitae (CV)
- Copy of Certificate of Graduation
- Official transcript of academic records
- English proficiency score record
- Copy of passport
- Study plan / description of academic interests
- One 1-inch-colored photo (with a blue background, taken no more than six months ago, in polite attire, and signed on the reverse side)
- Two recommendation letters
- Health certificate
- Nomination letter from the home institution
Timeline: March 28th (2025) : Previous deadline for 2025 intake (Round 1), May 30th (2025) : Previous deadline for 2025 intake (Round 2), June 30th (2025) : Previous deadline for 2025 intake (Round 3), 2025-10-13 : Main Application Deadline for 2026 intake, December 2025 : Application period for 2026 admission cycle expected to commence, At least two weeks prior to university deadline : Submit application to chosen Faculty/Programme, After faculty submission : Faculty/Programme screens and recruits applicants, After faculty screening : Applicant's name forwarded to Office of Academic Affairs for final scholarship consideration

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The CGS is a comprehensive scholarship, covering a wide array of expenses, making it a highly attractive option for international students.

Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees: Full coverage for the duration of the program.
*   Registration fees: Covered.
*   Accommodation: Provided, often in university dormitories.
*   Stipend/Monthly allowance: A significant component for living expenses.
*   Medical insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance is provided.
*   Emergent medical care: Coverage for urgent medical needs.
*   Administration costs: For program students, this includes education and administration costs.
*   Expenditures to support student activities: Funds allocated to support student life and activities.
*   One-time settlement: A one-time payment to assist with initial settling-in costs.

Funding Details and Stipends:
Monthly stipends vary based on the study level:
*   Undergraduate students: CNY 2,500 per month (approximately 340 USD).
*   Master's students/General Scholars: CNY 3,000 per month (approximately 408 USD).
*   Doctoral students/Senior Scholars: CNY 3,500 per month (approximately 476 USD).

Special Note for UCAS Applicants: Master's applicants accepted at the University of Chinese Academy of Sciences (UCAS) receive a monthly stipend of RMB 3,500, with RMB 500 of this amount typically provided by the supervisor or the CAS Institute where the applicant is enrolled.

Overall, the scholarship can provide up to 8,984 USD per year, with a general monthly allowance for personal expenses ranging from 272-408 USD. For specific programs like the AASCU-designated scholarship, the value is approximately 10,000 USD, which is disbursed directly to the Chinese universities, not to individual students.

Exclusions:
It is important to note that the CGS generally does not cover visa fees, international travel fees, or application fees to universities.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The CGS is open to outstanding international students, teachers, and scholars globally. General requirements include:
*   Nationality: Open to citizens of all countries with diplomatic relations with China. Specific programs may target citizens of particular countries (e.g., US citizens for the US embassy program, South African citizens for the South Africa program).
*   Academic Background: Applicants must meet specific academic qualifications for their chosen study level.
*   Health: Applicants must be in good health, as evidenced by a Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
*   Other: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Master's program: minimum of three years of relevant work experience
Language_Certificate: Chinese-taught Programs: Valid HSK score report meeting university requirements. English or Other Language-taught Programs: Relevant language proficiency certificates (e.g., IELTS or TOEFL) in accordance with university requirements. Chinese Language Programs (Non-degree): No Chinese proficiency requirements. Preparatory Courses: Scholarship recipients of Chinese-taught programs who meet basic language requirements but lack advanced proficiency may be required to take up to one-year preparatory Chinese language courses.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens. Open to citizens of all countries with diplomatic relations with China. Specific programs may target citizens of particular countries. Successful scholarship applicants may be required to sign a contract committing them to return to their home country upon completion of their studies. Postgraduate students are expected to publish research achievements acknowledging UCAS/their institutes as academic institutions and stating that their research was funded by the Chinese Government Scholarship.
Career_Plan: Required as part of the study plan/research proposal, outlining aspired career path.
Other_Requirements:
*   Reference Letters: Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (for graduate/senior scholar programs), in Chinese or English.
*   Study Plan or Research Proposal: Detailed plan in English or Chinese (minimum 200 words for undergraduate, 800 words for Master's/PhD).
*   Pre-admission Documents: Highly recommended to obtain at least one pre-admission document from target Chinese universities.
*   Notarized Highest Diploma.
*   Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
*   Valid Ordinary Passport: Copy ensuring English name, Gender, Nationality, and Date of Birth are visible.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious, full scholarship program designed to attract outstanding international students, teachers, and scholars from across the globe to pursue academic and research opportunities in China. Administered primarily by the China Scholarship Council (CSC) in conjunction with various Chinese Embassies and Consulates, the CGS supports a wide range of study levels, including undergraduate, postgraduate (Master's and PhD), and non-degree Chinese language programs.
Application_Documents:
*   Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (in Chinese or English).
*   Copy of the submitted online application.
*   Supporting documentation as requested by the specific program or embassy.
*   Valid HSK score report (if applying for Chinese-taught programs).
*   Relevant language proficiency certificates (IELTS/TOEFL, if applicable for non-Chinese taught programs).
*   Pre-admission documents from universities (highly recommended).
*   Study Plan or Research Proposal (in English or Chinese, minimum 200 words for UG, 800 words for Masters/PhD).
*   Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (for graduate/senior scholar programs).
*   Notarized highest diploma.
*   Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
*   Valid ordinary passport, including pages with English name, Gender, Nationality, and Date of Birth.
Timeline:
Academic Year 2026/2027 : Application period open
2026-02-08 : Application Deadline (Sweden)
2026-02-25 : Application Deadline (Ireland)

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details: Primarily fully funded, covering full tuition fees and providing a monthly stipend for living expenses. Some awards may be partial tuition fee waivers, covering tuition for specific semesters. Covered expenses include: Full tuition fees, Monthly stipend for living expenses, Travel costs, Health insurance, Accommodation.
Eligibility_Criteria: International students from non-EU/EEA countries (and Switzerland) who are eligible to pay tuition fees in Denmark. Must be highly qualified and outstanding students. Must be enrolling in specific Master's degree programs at SDU. Scholarships can only be awarded for programs offered on SDU's Vejle campus. Applicants who are eligible to receive the Danish State Grant cannot be considered for this scholarship. Applicants must first complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master's program at SDU. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible for the scholarship.
Language_Certificate: IELTS: A minimum score of 6.5. TOEFL: A minimum score of 575 (paper-based), 230 (computer-based), or 88 (internet-based).
Other_Requirements: A secondary school leaving certificate (minimum 210 hours at high school level) is required. No application fee is required for the scholarship itself.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU) is a prestigious, primarily fully funded opportunity for highly qualified international students from non-EU/EEA countries (and Switzerland) to pursue Master's degree programs. Funded by the Danish Ministry of Higher Education and Science, this scholarship aims to attract top global talent to SDU, recognized as one of the world's top 50 universities. The scholarship is part of Denmark's broader initiative to attract talented international students, acknowledging the significant impact and investment that non-EU/EEA students bring to the country's higher education system. SDU offers a dynamic academic and multicultural environment.
Application_Documents: While not explicitly listed, applicants will need to submit standard Master's program admission documents through the SDU portal.
Timeline: 2026-02-01 : Primary application deadline for 2026 intake (other sources mention November 30, 2025, or January 8, 2026, which may pertain to different application rounds or previous years; applicants are advised to confirm). September 2026 : Autumn semester typically begins.

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The GOI-IES is a fully funded scholarship, providing comprehensive financial support for one academic year of full-time study. The benefits include:
*   Full Tuition Fee Waiver: The scholarship covers the full tuition fees for the duration of the one-year study program.
*   Stipend: A €10,000 stipend is provided to support student costs and living expenses. This fund is typically disbursed as a monthly stipend.
*   Covered Expenses: The scholarship explicitly covers tuition fees, a significant stipend, and contributes towards the student's living expenses, making it a highly attractive financial package.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to exceptional, high-calibre international students whose domiciliary of origin is outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom (non-EU/non-EEA countries). Applicants must have secured a conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate program at NFQ levels 9 (Master's or Postgraduate Diploma) or 10 (PhD). The scholarship supports study at Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD level for one year of full-time study. There is no age limit prescribed for applicants.
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but outstanding academic record required.
Language_Certificate: Required by chosen institution for admission, not a direct scholarship requirement.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program designed to attract exceptional, high-calibre international students from non-EU/EEA countries to pursue postgraduate studies in Ireland. Funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA), the scholarship awards 60 recipients annually. It covers a full tuition fee waiver and a €10,000 stipend for one academic year of full-time study at Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD level (NFQ levels 9 or 10) across all disciplines.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic Transcripts
*   Recommendation Letters (also referred to as reference letters)
*   Personal Statements
*   Copy of Conditional or Final Offer of Admission/Valid Offer Letter
Timeline: Applications for 2025/26 academic year: Open, 2025-03-05: Application Deadline

Funding_Details:
A grant of €10,020 per academic year is provided to cover living expenses.
Scholarship recipients benefit from a full tuition fee waiver for their chosen Master's program.
The scholarship duration is one academic year for Master's programs comprising 60 ECTS credits, or two academic years for programs of 120 ECTS credits.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Open to outstanding students from all countries worldwide.
The applicant's previous degree (used for Master's program admission) must not have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution.
Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible to apply.
International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) are still eligible.
Applicants must apply to take up a Master's degree program at a Flemish higher education institution.
The student must be accepted by the host institution for a degree program to receive the scholarship. This acceptance can occur even after the initial scholarship selection.
The Master Mind scholarship cannot be combined with any other scholarship from the Flemish Government.
A minimum GPA of 3.5 is generally required.
Applicants must be applying for a Master's degree program, implying the possession of a relevant Bachelor's degree for admission.
No specific minimum years or types of professional experience are explicitly stated as requirements for this scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: Philosophy, Economics, Business Engineering, Information Systems Engineering, Information Management, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Energy, Materials Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Nuclear Engineering, Safety Engineering
Eligible_Field_Group: SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, STEM - ENGINEERING, STEM - COMPUTER SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES
Language_Certificate: Proof of English language proficiency (online tests like IELTS Indicator and TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition are accepted).
Other_Requirements:
Previous degree must not have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution.
Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible to apply (exception for credit mobility).
Must apply to a Master's degree program at a Flemish higher education institution.
Must be accepted by the host institution for a degree program.
Cannot be combined with any other scholarship from the Flemish Government.
Targets "outstanding students" worldwide.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship, provided by the Government of Flanders and its Ministry of Education and Training, offers an exceptional opportunity for outstanding international students to pursue fully funded Master's degree programs in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium. This prestigious scholarship aims to attract top talent worldwide, covering tuition fees and providing a substantial grant for living expenses.
Application_Documents:
Master Mind Scholarship Application Form (mandatory, specific to the host institution or general)
Host Institution's Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applicable, e.g., KU Leuven)
A passport photo
Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of your (previous) home university, University of Applied Sciences, School of Arts, or a recent employer.
Proof of English language proficiency (online tests like IELTS Indicator and TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition are accepted).
Timeline:
Application Opening : Applications for the 2026 Master Mind Scholarships are now open.
2026-01-15 : Master's Program Application Deadline (for the 2026-2027 academic year), including scholarship candidacy forms.
2026-2027 academic year : Scholarship Period.
Selection Process: Host Institution Application -> Nomination by Host Institution -> Pre-selection Notification -> Final Award by Flemish Ministry of Education and Training.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full tuition coverage: Complete coverage of academic fees for the chosen program.
Monthly stipends: A monthly allowance equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages, intended to cover living expenses.
Health insurance: Comprehensive health coverage for the duration of the scholarship.
Visa fees: Reimbursement or coverage of visa application costs.
Immigration support: Assistance with immigration processes.
One-time grant for foreign identification card issuance: A grant to cover the cost of obtaining the necessary identification document in Colombia.
Installation expenses: Financial support for initial setup costs upon arrival.
Expenses for books and materials: Coverage for academic resources.
No application fee: The application process itself is free of charge.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be a foreign citizen from any nationality and not hold Colombian nationality (including dual nationality).
Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided there for the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship. Applicants must also not have started studies in Colombia at the time of application.
Must not have been a beneficiary of the Beca Colombia program in previous calls.
Must be between 25 and 49 years old (not older than 50 years).
Must have a cumulative general average of 4.0 out of 5.0 (or its equivalent) from their undergraduate studies.
Scholarship recipients must agree to return to their country of origin or residence after the academic program ends. They also agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the scholarship end date, as the program's purpose is to facilitate the application of acquired knowledge in their home country.
Experience_Years: at least 1 or 2 years of work experience
Language_Certificate: Spanish language proficiency test (DELE or SIELE) with a minimum B2 level, or another supporting certificate
Special_Circumstances: Encourages and supports applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries by offering Spanish language strengthening opportunities.
Career_Plan: Recipients must return to their country of origin or residence after the academic program ends and agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the scholarship end date, to facilitate the application of acquired knowledge in their home country.
Other_Requirements:
Applicants are required to submit reference letters from referees who can attest to their academic and professional capabilities.
Candidates must have secured admission to at least one (and up to three) postgraduate programs listed in the Academic Offer Catalog 2025-2 prior to applying for the scholarship.
Scholarship_Info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship offered by the Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad (ICETEX). This program is designed for international students wishing to pursue postgraduate studies in Colombia. It forms a key part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, aiming to foster academic, cultural, and technological exchange, and strengthen social ties between international students and Colombian institutions.
Application_Documents:
Verified copies of Educational Transcripts (undergraduate and any previous postgraduate studies).
Experience report signed by the tutor or director of the academic program (if applicable).
Certificate from the University stating current enrollment and duration (if currently enrolled in a program).
Reference letters from academic or professional referees.
Proof of admission to an eligible postgraduate program in Colombia.
Spanish language proficiency certificate (DELE, SIELE B2 level, or equivalent).
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2025-2026 academic year
2025-06-13 : Application Deadline
Up to 6 months : Scholarship Duration for Perfectioning of Spanish
Up to 18 months : Scholarship Duration for Specialization
Up to 24 months : Scholarship Duration for Master's
Up to 48 months : Scholarship Duration for Doctorate
Annually : Scholarship renewal for programs longer than 12 months

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses:
*   100% tuition coverage
*   Monthly living allowances
*   Research funding
*   Accommodation Allowance: 7,000–9,000 Baht/month (depending on location)
Costs NOT Covered:
*   Pre-existing illnesses
*   Dental treatment
*   Brain disease
*   Mental illness
*   Pregnancy
*   Glasses
*   Travel insurance (awardees are advised to obtain their own)
*   Costs arising from loss or theft of personal belongings
*   All visa application costs (including visa fee, travel cost to the Royal Thai Embassy/Consulate, postal fee, and transit visa fee).
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from developing countries, specifically allocated for certain member states, including some OIC Member States. Primarily targets government officials from developing countries. Candidates must be officially nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or by relevant central government agencies for which the nominated candidates currently work.
Eligible_Fields: Agricultural Sciences, Biomedicine, Climate Change, Environmental Management, Environmental Science, Food Science, Food Security, Medicine, Pharmacy, Public Health
Eligible_Field_Group: HEALTH & MEDICINE, INTERDISCIPLINARY & SPECIALIZED, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES
Experience_Years: Relevant professional experience within government agencies (no minimum years explicitly stated)
Language_Certificate: General language requirements are set by Thai scholarship programs; no specific IELTS or TOEFL scores are provided for TIPP itself. However, general postgraduate IELTS scores of 6.5-7.0 are often typical for university admissions in Thailand.
Special_Circumstances: International students from developing countries, including OIC Member States; primarily targets government officials.
Other_Requirements: Official nomination by the candidate's National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation or relevant central government agencies; strict academic standards are maintained throughout the program.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship initiative by the Royal Thai Government, administered by the Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA) under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Established in either 1999 or 2000, TIPP aims to foster cooperation among developing countries by sharing Thailand's expertise and best practices. It primarily targets government officials from developing nations, offering Master's (and potentially Ph.D.) scholarships in fields aligned with sustainable development goals. The program aims to expand Thailand’s commitment to fostering cooperation partnerships, share best practices, build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allow participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality.
Application_Documents: Applicants are required to fill out an official Application Form. The complete application procedure involves submitting a hard copy of the application form and other related documents. Guidelines, a list of eligible countries/territories, and application forms are made available annually.
Timeline:
1999 or 2000 : Program established
2022-05-20 : Application Deadline for 2022 intake
2025-01-31 : Application Deadline for 2025 intake (submission to Royal Thai Embassy/Mission/Consulate General)
2025-11-09 : Application Deadline for 2026 intake

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Tianjin Government Scholarship offers both full and partial funding. It is a one-year duration scholarship that can be applied for year by year.
Funding Details:
*   Master's Degree Funding: CNY 10,000 (likely an annual amount).
*   Stipend/Living Allowance: Up to CNY 2,000 per month.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Living allowance/Stipend
*   Comprehensive medical insurance fees
*   Accommodation
Quantity: The exact number of awards varies each year and by institution. For instance, 178 applicants were nominated for the 2020 scholarship at Tianjin University, and 173 applicants were finalized by the Tianjin Municipal Education Commission in another instance.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens. The scholarship is available for both prospective international students applying to universities in Tianjin and current international students already enrolled in Tianjin universities. Applicants are not eligible if they have previously received a Tianjin Government Scholarship. For current students, applicants must be foreign self-funded students who have normally enrolled in Tianjin. Applicants must apply to Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin that are eligible to enroll international students for this scholarship.
Language_Certificate:
For Chinese-Instructed Programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180. For Science and Engineering programs, an HSK level 4 with a minimum score of 180 may be accepted. For Arts programs, an HSK level 5 with a minimum score of 180 is typically required.
For English-Instructed Programs: English Proficiency Certificate. English native speakers are exempted.
General Requirement: Applicants should meet the specific language requirements of their chosen higher education institution and provide relevant proofs.
Other_Requirements: A Personal Statement, including a study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths, is mandatory. For Master's degree applicants, this statement should be no less than 800 words and written in Chinese or English.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious award provided by the Tianjin Government in China. It is designed to attract outstanding international students to pursue higher education within universities located in Tianjin. The scholarship is open to non-Chinese citizens and supports study at various degree levels, including Master's programs. It offers both full and partial funding, providing comprehensive financial support to its recipients. It is a one-year duration scholarship that can be applied for year by year.
Application_Documents:
Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (requires online application registration).
Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, no less than 800 words for Master Degree, written in Chinese or English).
Bachelor diploma (for Master's applicants).
English Proficiency Certificate or HSK certificate (as per language requirements).
Other Chinese learning and examination certificates (if applicable).
Timeline:
2024-10-15 : Applications opened for 2025 intake at Tianjin University
2025-05-31 : Application deadline for 2025 intake at Tianjin University (closed)
2026-05-30 : Application deadline for Nankai University
One week : Assessment results publicized before submission to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission
July 1 - August 31 : Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) issuance to scholarship winners

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Grantees receive a monthly stipend of €900, totaling up to €9,000 for the entire scholarship duration. The scholarship duration can vary between three, six, or nine months, depending on the specific course or program. The grant is intended to cover living and studying costs in Italy and is only disbursed for periods the grantee physically spends in Italy.
Exemption from payment of enrollment and tuition fees at Italian public or legally recognized educational institutions.
Health and Medical/Accident insurance, contracted by MAECI, for the entire duration of the grant. It is important to note that insurance coverage will not apply to events derived from pre-existing physical and pathological conditions.
A monthly stipend of €900, up to a total of €9,000.
Quantity: Maximum of 9 scholarships/grants for a six-month duration (for some specific calls)
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to foreign students living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE - Italian Residents Abroad). The program covers applicants from 143 countries and territories worldwide.
Eligible_Field_Group: ARTS & DESIGN, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, STEM - ARCHITECTURE & PLANNING, STEM - COMPUTER SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY, STEM - ENGINEERING, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but academic performance is a factor
Experience_Years: Not a general formal requirement, but 1 or 2 years of work experience might be considered beneficial or required for certain opportunities.
Language_Certificate: Italian language proficiency at minimum B2 CEFR level for Italian-taught courses; English language proficiency certificate for English-taught programs. Generally, B2 level in either Italian or English is expected.
Age: Bachelor’s Degree: not exceed 23 years; Master’s Degree, AFAM, Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses: not exceed 28 years (28 years and 364 days at deadline); PhD Programs: not exceed 30 years.
Special_Circumstances: Scholarship can be renewed if performance requirements are met. Insurance coverage will not apply to events derived from pre-existing physical and pathological conditions.
Other_Requirements: PhD applicants require a letter of acceptance from an Italian University. The MAECI grant is incompatible with any other grant from the Italian Government or public institutions (including DSU). Proof of income is required (e.g., Salary certificate, Job ID/Visiting Card, TIN certificate, Income tax certificate for salaried persons).
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship (MAECI) is a prestigious, fully funded initiative by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). It supports international students and Italian citizens living abroad in pursuing higher education, research, or advanced Italian language and culture studies in Italy. The scholarship aims to foster international cooperation, promote Italian language and culture, and support Italy's economic system globally, aligning with values such as sustainability and innovation. It provides financial and academic support, making Italian higher education accessible and strengthening Italy's global ties.
Application_Documents:
Certificate of Italian language proficiency (minimum B2 CEFR level) for Italian-taught courses, or English language proficiency certificate for English-taught programs.
Letter of acceptance from an Italian University (mandatory for PhD applicants).
Proof of income (e.g., Salary certificate, Job ID/Visiting Card, TIN certificate, Income tax certificate for salaried persons).
Appropriate academic qualifications (e.g., bachelor's degree for master's, master's degree for PhD).
Timeline:
April 25, 2025 : Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year opened
May 16, 2025, 2:00 PM CET : Primary application deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year
November 5, 2025 : Other potential deadline
January 10, 2026 : Other potential deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Australian Government provides funding to eligible Higher Education Providers (HEPs) to support domestic and overseas students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. RTP scholarships are designed to support high-quality Higher Degree by Research (HDR) candidates and typically include three main components: RTP Fees Offset, RTP Stipends, and RTP Allowances.

Duration:
*   Research Doctorate (full-time): A minimum of 3 years, up to a maximum of 4 years at the discretion of the HEP. Some universities, like ANU, specify 3.5 years with the possibility of extension. ACU confirms a 3-year duration for full-time Research Doctorate stipends.
*   Research Doctorate (part-time): A minimum of 6 years, up to a maximum of 8 years.
*   Research Masters (full-time): 2 years. ACU confirms a 2-year duration for full-time Research Masters stipends.

Stipend (Living Costs):
*   AUD$33,511 per annum (2025 rate, as seen at Curtin and UTAS).
*   AUD$34,752 annually (ACIR, year not specified).

Allowances:
*   Relocation costs: Up to A$2,000 (e.g., at UniSC, also mentioned by ANU and UTAS).
*   Travel and removal allowances: Mentioned by ANU.
*   Thesis allowance: Up to AU$840 for a doctoral thesis or up to AU$420 for a master by research thesis (e.g., at UTS).
*   Overseas Student Health Care Policy (OSHC): Provided for international students (e.g., ACU, UTS, University of Sydney). ACU specifies that this is typically a 'single policy' unless a 'dual-family policy' or 'multi-family policy' is approved by the Director, Graduate Research School or Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Research and Enterprise).

Covered Expenses:
*   RTP Fees Offset (tuition fees, often 100% for up to 14 research periods at the University of Sydney).
*   RTP Stipends (living costs).
*   RTP Allowances (including relocation, travel, thesis, and OSHC).
Quantity: Not specified. Anecdotal information suggests that most universities award approximately 10% of their RTP scholarships to international students, indicating a competitive environment.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be prospective or current Higher Degree by Research (HDR) students undertaking a Research Doctorate or Research Masters degree. Scholarships are offered to high-achieving domestic and international students.

General Criteria:
*   Must be enrolled in an accredited Research Higher Degree.
*   Must not be receiving income from another source to support general living costs (as per Flinders University rules).
*   Domestic students are required to have a Commonwealth Higher Education Student Support Number (CHESSN) (e.g., Curtin).
*   Applicants who are unsuccessful in two prior applications for the RTP scholarship at Bond University are ineligible to apply for future scholarship rounds at that institution.
*   Current HDR students at a university (e.g., Curtin) must meet specific criteria to be eligible for centrally supported scholarships.
*   Recipients of a part-time scholarship may be subject to employment restrictions (e.g., UTAS).
Min_Gpa: A strong academic record and high GPA are consistently required for eligibility. Applicants generally need very good grades in a relevant Masters degree. Anecdotal evidence from domestic students suggests a Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of 85+ or a perfect/near-perfect GPA is often necessary for successful applications, particularly for highly competitive fields. Selection is based on academic results for prior study and demonstrated research potential. GPA calculation methods may vary by university.
Experience_Years: At least six months of relevant supervised research experience with outstanding results (possibly as part of a Masters degree) is considered beneficial, according to unofficial sources.
Min_Working_Hours: Full-time HDR candidates are generally required to work approximately 35 hours per week on their research (e.g., UNE).
Language_Certificate: No specific language test requirements are mentioned as part of the RTP scholarship guidelines themselves. However, individual universities will have their own English language proficiency requirements for admission to HDR programs, which applicants must meet.
Other_Requirements:
Strong referee letters are highly recommended, preferably from academics who supervised prior research (unofficial source).
Applicants must contact their chosen eligible higher education provider (HEP) directly for specific application, selection, and offer processes, as these vary by institution.
Familiarization with university-specific RTP scholarship policies and procedures is required.
Some universities (e.g., Curtin) may require an Invitation to Apply from a registered supervisor as a preliminary step.
Confirmation of a qualified supervisor, available space, and resources aligned with the university's research strategy is often necessary (e.g., ANU).
Having something to make an applicant stand out, such as authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper accepted in a well-regarded journal, or notable academic prizes/commendations, can significantly enhance an application (unofficial source).
Scholarship_Info: The Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship is a prestigious program providing financial support for high-quality Higher Degree by Research (HDR) candidates. It is funded by the Australian Government and administered by Australian universities to support high-achieving domestic and international research students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. The RTP Fee Offset component is often automatically offered to all domestic students admitted to a Masters by Research or doctoral degree. This scholarship can be packaged with other tuition scholarships for international students and is available for Joint Research Awards when the Australian university is the home institution.
Application_Documents:
Application processes are highly university-specific.
Some universities (e.g., Curtin) may require an Expression of Interest form as a first step.
Many universities (e.g., Monash, UniSC) utilize an online portal for both course admission and scholarship applications.
A common practice is for eligible applicants to be automatically considered for all available graduate research scholarships, including RTP, without needing to select specific ones (e.g., Monash, UniSC).
Timeline:
2025-09-01 : Federation University (2026 RTP stipend) Application Opening Date
2025-10-01 : Australian Catholic University (ACU) (2025/2026) Application Deadline (11:59 PM AEST)
2026-06-19 : Charles Sturt University (International, 2027 commencement) Application Deadline
Application deadlines are university-specific and vary significantly.
Application opening dates are also university-specific.
ACU : Applications open twice per annum, typically in April and October.
University of Adelaide (2025) : Applications were open as of a recent announcement.
Offers for stipend and fee offset scholarships are typically made around the same time as course offers.
Offers for scholarships are generally made concurrently with, or shortly after, course admission offers.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers tuition fees, living expenses, and accommodation. A monthly stipend is specifically provided for students undertaking the mandatory Romanian language preparatory year.
Covered Expenses:
* Tuition fees (for the preparatory year and the actual university studies)
* Accommodation in student dormitories
* Living expenses (monthly stipend, particularly during the preparatory year)
* Medical assistance in case of emergencies (as per national regulations)
* Local public transport facilities (as per national regulations)
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be citizens of non-EU and non-EFTA countries. Candidates must demonstrate good academic results, with an average for the last graduated school of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the Romanian scoring system, or a "Good" score.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: While specific years of professional experience are not explicitly mandated, the scholarship may require applicants to have relevant prior experience or a certain level of diploma in their field of study, particularly for Master's and PhD programs.
Language_Certificate: For Bachelor's and Master's studies, a mandatory preparatory year for the study of the Romanian language is granted. For PhD studies, English language programs are optional, requiring proof of English proficiency but no explicit IELTS or TOEFL certificate.
Age: Undergraduate Applicants: Minimum 18 and maximum 26 years (by July 01, 2025). Master's Applicants: Maximum 35 years (by July 01, 2025). PhD Applicants: Maximum 45 years (by July 01, 2025).
Special_Circumstances: Applicants with certain unspecified conditions are not eligible to apply. Studies in Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy are explicitly not eligible for this scholarship program.
Career_Plan: A motivation letter is generally expected and often outlines an applicant's academic and career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit all required documents accurately and completely. Successful candidates are obliged to observe the laws in force in Romania, as well as the school and university rules, regulations, and norms for social life.
Scholarship_Info: The Romanian Government Scholarship, administered through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) and the "Study in Romania" platform, is a prestigious, fully funded annual scholarship program designed for outstanding students from non-EU and non-EFTA countries. It aims to promote Romanian higher education, foster cultural exchange, and deepen bilateral relations.
Application_Documents:
* Completed application form (online via the Study in Romania platform)
* Copy of Passport
* Copy of Birth Certificate (with authorized translation into English, French, Spanish, or Romanian)
* Copies of Educational Certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor's, Master's, PhD if applicable) with authorized translation into English, French, Spanish, or Romanian.
* Academic Papers (High school diploma for BSc, Bachelor's degree for MSc, Master's degree for PhD)
* Transcript of current academic records (for final-year students, until application submission, with authorized translation into English, French, Spanish, or Romanian)
* Certificate proving final-year graduation exam (for final-year students, with authorized translation into English, French, Spanish, or Romanian)
* Two reference letters (specifically for Master's applicants)
* Applicant's CV (preferably in Europass format)
* Motivation Letter (implied)
* Proof of name change (if applicable) + authorized translation
Timeline:
2025-01-29 : Application Opening Date
2025-03-12 : Application Deadline
After application period closes and evaluation is complete : Results Announcement

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fees: Full tuition fee coverage for the entire duration of the study program.
Stipend: A monthly living allowance.
Airfare: Round-trip international airfare from the applicant's home country to Indonesia.
Health Insurance: Health insurance coverage with a maximum monthly premium of IDR 200,000.
Research and Book Allowance: A monthly allowance for research and books, provided upon arrival in Indonesia.
Scholarship Duration: Master's Degree: 3 years; Doctoral Degree: 4 years.
Quantity: Approximately 200 KNB Scholarship applicants annually across all levels of study and fields.
Eligibility_Criteria: Designed for prospective international students from developing countries to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees at Indonesian universities. The scholarship is a key component of Indonesia's global cooperation efforts, specifically contributing to South–South Partnership initiatives. Applicants must be citizens of developing countries. Open to both male and female applicants. Result-awaiting students may also apply based on their initial academic records. Applicants must intend to study full-time.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Varies by program: 2.30/3.00 or equivalent; 3.0/4.0 for Bachelor's Degree holders.
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience specified, but work history encouraged.
Language_Certificate: English or Japanese proficiency required. Valid test scores (within 2 years) for TOEFL ITP (min 500), TOEFL IBT (min 61, some 80), IELTS (min 6.0), TOEIC (min 575, some 700), or JLPT for Japanese programs.
Special_Circumstances: Result-awaiting students may also apply based on their initial academic records.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must intend to study full-time. Specific study programs and requirements may differ between participating universities.
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship, popularly known as the KNB Scholarship, is a prestigious, fully funded program offered by the Government of Indonesia. It is designed for prospective international students from developing countries to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees at top Indonesian universities. As part of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts under the South–South Partnership, the scholarship aims to foster academic excellence and cultural exchange. The program covers a wide array of academic fields and provides comprehensive financial support, making it a highly sought-after opportunity for students globally.
Application_Documents:
Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General in the applicant's home country (mandatory).
Recommendation letter from the potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicants).
Recommendation letter from the employer/immediate supervisor (if currently working).
Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools/universities.
Academic Certificate from previous degrees.
Academic Transcript from previous degrees.
Language proficiency test scores (valid within 2 years).
Essay (if required during selection process).
Timeline:
February 17 - March 7, 2025 : Application Opening (2025 cycle)
March 3 - March 21, 2025 : Application Deadline (2025 cycle)
June 13, 2025 : Selection Results Announcement (2025 cycle)
January 15, 2026 : Application Deadline
February 16, 2026 : Application Deadline (KNB Scholarship 2026)
Annually : Application Deadlines vary
Annually : Selection results announced online via KNB Scholarship Website and Indonesian Embassy network

Scholarship_Name: Azerbaijan Government Scholarship (Educational Grant for OIC/NAM)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a fully funded scholarship designed to provide comprehensive support to selected candidates throughout their studies in Azerbaijan. The benefits include:
*   Full Tuition Fees: All academic tuition costs are covered.
*   International Flights: An annual round-trip international flight is provided.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly allowance of 800 AZN (approximately 470 USD) is provided to cover meals, accommodation, and utilities.
*   Medical Insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance, valued at 200 AZN, is included.
*   Visa and Registration Costs: All expenses related to visa application and registration in Azerbaijan are fully covered.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of OIC Member States and Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) countries, encompassing over 150 nations. National or local students of Azerbaijan are not eligible for this scholarship. A crucial requirement is the official nomination by the applicant's home country government authorities (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Ministry of Education). Only officially nominated candidates proceed to the second stage of the application process.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, MPhil
Min_Gpa: Previous degree(s): 70% (on a scale of 0 to 100, or 7 on a scale of 10, or equivalent), Renewal: 3.0
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years mandated, professional experience at a postgraduate level is considered relevant.
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in English, Russian, Turkish, or Azerbaijani required. Specific scores: IELTS 5 / TOEFL 40 (for some programs), IELTS 5.5 / TOEFL 50 (for Master’s/PhD and other programs).
Age: Under 35 for undergraduate and general medicine programs, Under 40 for graduate and medical residency programs, Under 45 for doctoral programs.
Special_Circumstances: Citizens of OIC Member States and Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) countries, encompassing over 150 nations. This includes specific provisions for Small Island Developing States, Pakistan/AJ&K nationals (3 scholarships: 1 bachelor, 1 master, 1 doctoral), and Ugandan scholars.
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters from academic or professional referees are required. Applicants should demonstrate strong motivation and leadership potential. Applicants with foreign qualifications must have their documents equated by relevant national authorities (e.g., UNEB for undergraduate and NCHE for postgraduate for Ugandan scholars). Stronger grades in major subjects relevant to the area of study are advantageous.
Scholarship_Info: The Azerbaijan Government Scholarship, officially known as the "Heydar Aliyev - International Education Grant Program," is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship opportunity for international students. Established by the decree of President Ilham Aliyev on July 8, 2023, this program is dedicated to Heydar Aliyev, the founder of modern Azerbaijan, and aims to support the education of foreigners in Azerbaijani higher education institutions. It is provided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Science and Education of the Republic of Azerbaijan, in conjunction with the Azerbaijan International Development Agency (AIDA), and is part of the OIC Education Programme. The scholarship facilitates studies across various academic levels in Azerbaijan.
Application_Documents:
- Completed nomination form.
- Application letter with a recent passport photograph, indicating age, sex, course, home district, telephone contact, and email address.
- Photocopies of academic certificates and transcripts (Diplomas and Transcripts from prior High School or Higher Education Institution). The applicant’s academic marks (GPA) of the previous degree(s) must not be less than 70 (on a scale of 0 to 100 or 7 on a scale of 10 or equivalent).
- Copy of a valid passport.
- Research Proposal (for Ph.D. applicants).
- Two Recommendation Letters from academic or professional referees.
Timeline:
2024-04-20 : Submission of applications (first stage) to relevant government authorities (Start)
2024-05-20 : Submission of applications (first stage) to relevant government authorities (End)
2024-05-21 : Review and evaluation of candidates by respective government authorities (Start)
2024-06-15 : Review and evaluation of candidates by respective government authorities (End)
2024-06-16 : Registration of applications (second stage) in the SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service) (Start)
2024-07-01 : Registration of applications (second stage) in the SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service) (End)
2024-07-01 : Review and evaluation of candidates (by Azerbaijan) (Start)
2024-08-15 : Review and evaluation of candidates (by Azerbaijan) (End)
2024-08-16 : Notification of selected candidates (Start)
2024-08-30 : Notification of selected candidates (End)
2024-09-15 : Start of academic year
2024-09-30 : Last date for arrival in the Republic of Azerbaijan
2025-03-26 : Call for Applications (for 2025-2026 Academic Year)
2025-05-15 : Nomination Deadline (First Stage) (for 2025-2026 Academic Year)
2025-06-01 : Online Application (Second Stage) in SIACAS (Start for 2025-2026 Academic Year)
2025-06-15 : Online Application (Second Stage) in SIACAS (End for 2025-2026 Academic Year)

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details: Scholarships are provided to cover living costs during the stay and include travel allowances. For international students and PhD students, the scholarships cover living costs and travel allowances. For scholarship holders from Slovakia, travel allowances are provided for all categories. The programme offers up to €1,470 monthly for Masters and PhD studies. Covered expenses include living costs and travel allowances (flat rate to cover travel costs).
Eligibility_Criteria:
The programme supports the mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists for scholarship stays at higher education institutions and research organizations in Slovakia. It also supports the mobility of Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for stays outside Slovakia.

Specific Eligibility for International Applicants (for stays in Slovakia):
*   PhD students: Must be pursuing higher education or scientific training outside Slovakia and be accepted by a Slovak university or research institution (e.g., Slovak Academy of Sciences) for an academic mobility stay (study, research, or artistic stay).
*   International nationals (excluding Slovakia): Must be studying or working outside Slovakia and be accepted by a Slovak host institution for a mobility stay. Applicants should not have previously studied in Slovakia but must be admitted or invited to a local university for the mobility stay.

Ineligibility Criteria for International Applicants:
*   International students and PhD students accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or those already studying a full degree in Slovakia who wish to fund their studies by the NSP. The programme is specifically for mobility stays, not full degree programmes.
*   University teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) who, at the application deadline, have more than 4 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist (PhD studies are considered as work experience). However, in special cases (e.g., force majeure), candidates without a PhD degree but with more than 4 years but not more than 7 years of work experience may be accepted, but will be awarded a scholarship corresponding to applicants without a PhD degree and with less than 4 years of experience.
*   International applicants who, within the 36 months prior to the application deadline, have spent 15 or more months (in total) in the Slovak Republic.
*   International applicants who are accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia within the framework of other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g., International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, etc.).
Experience_Years: For university teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree: generally ineligible if more than 4 years of work experience; in special cases, 4-7 years may be accepted but with a lower scholarship amount. PhD studies count as work experience.
Special_Circumstances: In extraordinary circumstances caused by force majeure, the scholarship programme administrator may initially accept unofficial translations of documents. However, official translations will be required before the official letter of award is issued. Special consideration may also be given to university teachers/researchers/artists without a PhD degree but with 4-7 years of work experience, as detailed in the eligibility section.
Career_Plan: A detailed study programme or research plan is mandatory. For PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists, the invitation letter should reflect the host institution's genuine interest in the applicant's proposed stay.
Other_Requirements: Minimum SAT score of 1100. Two recommendation letters from professors or supervisors/university teachers are required. Invitation/admission letter from a Slovak host institution (a scan is needed for the online application; the original document must be sent directly to the SAIA office in Bratislava by the host institution). Original documents with official translations into Slovak or English language are required; if documents are in other languages, official translations are required.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP) is a prestigious mobility scholarship established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic. It is primarily funded by the Ministry of Education, Research, Development, and Youth and administered by SAIA. The programme aims to support academic, research, teaching, and artistic stays in Slovakia for international applicants, and also supports Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for stays outside Slovakia. It enables short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays at Slovak higher education and research institutions, fostering international academic and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents: The online application requires the submission of: Curriculum Vitae, Motivation letter, Detailed study programme or research plan, Two recommendation letters from professors or supervisors/university teachers, Confirmation of current enrollment (for students and PhD candidates), Academic transcripts and degree certificates, Invitation/admission letter from a Slovak host institution, Original documents with official translations into Slovak or English language (unofficial translations may be accepted temporarily in force majeure situations, with official versions required later).
Timeline:
2005 : Programme established
2019-2020 academic year : More than 4,100 scholarships awarded
Currently open : Call for applications for summer semester 2026/2027 and 2026 edition of the program
2025-10-31 : Application deadline for scholarship stays during summer semester of 2026 (by 16:00 CET)
2026-04-30 : Application deadline for scholarship stays during summer semester of academic year 2026/2027 or entire 2026-2027 academic year program
2026-10-31 : Application deadline for scholarship stays during winter semester of academic year 2026/2027

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Full Scholarship: Typically provides ¥40,000 per year. While this amount is explicitly mentioned for Doctoral students, it represents the maximum annual reward for the BGS and can apply to Master's programs depending on the university and specific award.
Half Scholarship: Typically provides ¥20,000 per year (also specified for Doctoral students, but indicative for other levels).
Partial Scholarship: Covers half or a quarter of the tuition fee for one academic year.
Annual Living Stipend: A full scholarship generally includes an annual living stipend of approximately $4,489.
Covered Expenses:
Tuition fees (full or partial coverage).
Accommodation.
Living expenses (through the annual stipend).
Quantity: Not centrally specified, subject to university allocation.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be a non-Chinese citizen.
Must be in good health and willing to obey Chinese laws and regulations.
Must demonstrate academic excellence. For current students, the average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100.
Must be applying for admission to a degree program (Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD) at a university in the Beijing region, or already admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student at an eligible institution.
Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds concurrently.
Must hold a Bachelor's degree or its equivalent (for Master's applicants).
Experience_Years: Three years or more of work experience (for specific programs like IMBA)
Language_Certificate: IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 75+ or corresponding language proficiency (for English-taught majors, native English speakers exempt); HSK-5+ (for Chinese-taught postgraduate programs)
Special_Circumstances: Annual re-application and review required for continuation; Available for both prospective and current international students studying in Beijing; Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds concurrently.
Career_Plan: Statement of Purpose required, clearly indicating duration and purpose of study, preferred technical work or experience, and academic background.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must meet the basic admission requirements for international students at their chosen target university.
Scholarship_Info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS) is a prestigious award established by the Beijing Municipal Government to encourage and support outstanding international students to pursue higher education and conduct research within the Beijing region of China. It offers both fully funded and partially funded opportunities, primarily covering tuition fees, accommodation, and living expenses. The scholarship is available for various degree levels, including Master's programs, and requires annual re-application.
Application_Documents:
Application Form for Beijing Municipal Government Scholarship (obtained from the target HEI or downloaded from their website).
Statement of Purpose.
Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs).
Language proficiency certificates (IELTS/TOEFL for English-taught programs, HSK for Chinese-taught programs).
Valid passport copy.
Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
Academic transcripts and degree certificates (Bachelor's degree for Master's applicants).
Any other documents required by the specific university.
Timeline:
HEI-specific: Application opening and closing dates determined by individual Higher Education Institutions.
Approximately three months before study begins: Successful candidates receive Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice, and Visa Application Form for Study in China (JW201) from the HEI.
After receiving documents: Candidates apply for a study visa at the Chinese embassy or consulate-general.
Annually: Scholarship requires re-application and review for continuation.
Under four years: Typical scholarship duration for Master's degree programs.
Under one year: Scholarship duration for Chinese language training or specialized training.
